results.title: From the ashes
results.creator_credit: Helena Solberg Ladd, Glenn Silber and International Women's Film Project Productions
results.brief_description: A documentary tracing the history of Nicaragua from the presence of U.S. Marines in the early 1900s, through several rebellions to the problems of the present (up to 1981). The film focuses on the present efforts of the people to rebuild their country. Includes interviews.

results.title: From Partners to Parents
results.brief_description: From Partners to Parents is a program about the effects of a first baby on a marriage. It focuses on the adjustments faced by a young couple during the year following the birth of their first child and illustrates the different perceptions and reactions of each partner to some of the central issues of parenthood.

results.title: From page to screen
results.creator_credit: Ernest Troost, Morton Schindel, Paul R. Gagne and Weston Woods Studios
results.brief_description: This is the biography of a production company specialising in the adaption of children’s picture books onto the screen. Morton Schindel was a pioneer in his field when he set up in Weston Woods, Connecticut. His idea was to take the age old tradition of telling children stories and transfer it to film. In the 1950’s, when he began, picture books were not in schools as aids in teaching reading. “Dick and Jane” were relied on, but were not especially successful. Schindel consulted specialists and publishers in the children’s field to find books that met the criteria for adaption: Is the story meaningful to children? Do the illustrations reflect the text? Is the message universal? Will it stand the test of time? Initial choices, such as Ping and Mike Mulligan and his steam shovel, were produced, often with the help of the original illustrator. There was a strong response from children. They inspired children to look at the original book and were found to encourage reading. Children’s TV and schools were quick to take them up. Schindel named his company after the beautiful location of his studio and home, going on to produce many more high quality films of outstanding children’s books. This documentary tells the story and shows how the animations were done. Note: there are 126 Weston Woods titles in the Access Collection.

results.title: From Opera with Love
results.brief_description: This lively production dispels many widely held misconceptions about opera and shows that it can be as entertaining and exciting as a football match or a bullfight. Excerpts that are featured in this program are from, “the Pirates of Penzance”, “The Magic Flute”, “Carmen”, “Cosi fan tutte” and “The Barber of Seville”. Featuring Graham Blundell and Suzanne Johnston.

results.title: From magic mineral to modern miracle
results.creator_credit: J Lloyd Jones, Gas and Fuel Corporation of Victoria and Herschells Films
results.brief_description: An account of how coal provides us with warmth, light, dyes and perfumes, antiseptics, high explosives and coal gas, a valuable fuel for use in both home and industry.

results.title: From Indonesia to India
results.brief_description: The film starts with a typical day in Indonesia in the fields. It shows how New Zealand is providing assistance in training in agricultural methods and use of machinery. It goes on to Malaysia, Pakistan, Sarawak and India with emphasis on the New Zealand contribution under the Colombo Plan to medical technology, resource management and secondary education.

results.title: From Haiti to Trinidad
results.brief_description: A short travelogue containing documentary footage of various Caribbean Islands - Haiti, Barbados, Martinique, Puerto Rico, Trinidad. Includes shots of labourers interspersed with urban footage, topped off with a dash of sunny beaches. No commentary - English intertitles.

results.title: From Grisek: grade one
results.brief_description: For may years the rubber growers of Grisek, in Johore, Malaya, have been processing their own latex, with the result that it was of poor quality. Now, however, with the assistance of the Rural and Industrial Development Authority, they pool their resources and produce rubber. A modern factory enables first-class sheet rubber to be produced in ideal conditions and at the lowest possible cost. The rubber is then sold in bulk on the Singapore market.

results.title: From grass roots to green papers
results.brief_description: Activists in the Literacy movement got together with government representatives to develop policies and ideas regarding Literacy Issues in the International Literacy Year. The 13th National conference of the Australian Council for Adult Literacy was held in August 1989 in Tasmania.

results.title: From box kite to swing wing
results.brief_description: In 1914 the Australian Army started a flying school at Point Cook. The trainees took ten hours to learn to fly a Box Kite Plane. This video documents the history of air defence force planes from this humble beginning to their inclusion in World War I through to the sophisticated jet fighters that are the pride of the Royal Australian Air Force today.
